title: Always On Display never turns off !
content:
In Settings \ Display : Advanced \ Lock screen \ WHEN TO SHOW : Idle lock screen

I have 'On when you're nearby' set, which, in the past has been working as expected. The screen would go blank after a few seconds of no movement after pressing the power button ( I also have 'Reach to check phone' on).

Now, after updating to Android 11 this no longer works. What happens is when I press the power button the screen is blank briefly then the  AOD appears and never disappears after that. Also, I have noticed that if I reach for the phone or touch the phone the lock icon appears then a few seconds later it disappears and the screen dims (AOD still on) then after approx 3 seconds the AOD briefly turns off then on again like it is trying to go blank (no AOD) but cannot. No matter how long I leave the phone the AOD is always on. Under battery usage 'Ambient display' tops the list.

When using the new Bedtime mode (Android 11) [I have the beta version installed as this has contains the 'Keep the screen dark' option] I have the option 'Keep the screen dark' set to ON. This works. After I press the power button my screen is blank,  AOD is shown. Now when I reach for the phone AOD turns on.

So it seems the option  'Reach to check phone' is broken and not working when Bedtime mode is not active.

Anyone experiencing these issues?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4
